title: How to Flake Brazil Nuts

steps.headline: Boil up a saucepan of water.
steps.description: The saucepan should be large enough to fit the amount of Brazil nuts you intend to use.

steps.headline: Drop the Brazil nuts into the boiling water.
Leave them to boil for one to two minutes.
Drain the nuts well.
steps.description: Lay them out on kitchen paper towel and give them a quick rub to speed up the drying process.

steps.headline: When they are dry, use the vegetable peeler to peel them.
steps.description: Use lengthwise strokes. You will find that the flakes appear easily.

steps.headline: Store any unneeded flakes in an airtight container and keep in the fridge.
steps.description: Use within a few weeks, remembering that chopped nuts turn rancid quickly.

When they are dry, use the vegetable peeler to peel them. Use lengthwise strokes. You will find that the flakes appear easily. Store any unneeded flakes in an airtight container and keep in the fridge. Use within a few weeks, remembering that chopped nuts turn rancid quickly.
